questions.text: What does Kramer do to his hair in this episode?
questions.explanation:
He mousses it.

	Kramer says that moussing his hair makes him feel like he's starting a new life.  He had the pre-mousse life, and now he's entering the post-mousse life.

Ninety-four.

	Ms. Huddwalker lived in the apartment above Jerry's until she passed away.  She was found by the landlord, Harold, when he went to get her rent.

questions.text: Where is the vacant apartment that Jerry finds for Elaine?
questions.explanation:
Above his own apartment.

	Elaine is ecstatic about the idea because she is excited about getting a cheap apartment right above Jerry's.  Jerry is unsure about the idea after he realizes that she would be over all of the time.

questions.text: Elaine plans on paying two hundred dollars for the apartment.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Elaine is planning on paying four hundred dollars for the apartment.  Jerry is trying to think of reasons why Elaine should not take the apartment.

questions.text: Who gives George a ring to attempt his experiment to see if women would talk to him more?
questions.explanation:
Kramer.

	Jerry says to George that he should try wearing a wedding band around because George said his friend from Detroit gets more women around him when he wears it.

questions.text: What price was the apartment raised to after Harold got a new offer?
questions.explanation:
Five thousand dollars.

	Jerry is glad that someone else makes such a high offer because he knows that it will change Elaine's mind.

questions.text: Who suggests that Jerry should lend Elaine the money to get the apartment?
questions.explanation:
Kramer.

	Kramer states that Elaine could repay Jerry over a few years and that Jerry should do it because they're good friends.

questions.text: What is the class that Elaine is in with Roxanne?
questions.explanation:
Short stories class.

	Elaine goes around at a party telling everyone how Jerry got her the apartment.  People start emphasizing about how Elaine will be over all of the time.

questions.text: What is the occupation of George's fake wife?
questions.explanation:
Entomologist.

	George realizes that his idea to wear a wedding band was a dud when women actually wanted to date him, but didn't because he was married.

questions.text: The person who takes the apartment makes a lot of noise.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Jerry's new neighbour is a musician who has his band rehearse at the apartment.  Until late at night, Jerry has to listen to hard rock music.
